officialTitle: The Effectiveness of Domperidone Versus Alginic Acid Add on Omeprazole Therapy in Omeprazole Resistance Gastroesophageal Reflux in Systemic Sclerosis

arms.label: Omeprazole plus alginic acid and placebo of domperidone
Omeprazole plus domperidone and placebo of alginic acid

summary: The investigators purposes are to define the prevalence of omeprazole resistance gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) in systemic sclerosis (SSc), to compare the efficacy of omeprazole in combination with algycon versus omeprazole in combination with domperidone on the severity of reflux symptoms in omeprazole resistant GERD in SSc, and to compare the efficacy of omeprazole in combination with algycon versus omeprazole in combination with domperidone on the frequency of symptoms in omeprazole- resistant GERD in SSc.

primaryOutcome.measure: Changing Severity of Heart Burn of SSc Related Omeprazole Resistant GERD Evaluated by Visual Analogue Score (VAS)

effectByArm.arm: Omeprazole Plus Alginic Acid and Placebo of Domperidone
Omeprazole Plus Domperidone and Placebo of Alginic Acid
